member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.WCFReference.Interop.ServiceReferenceType
member.summary: Provides an enumeration for differentiating between references to a Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) service and references to Web services (.asmx) that use ASP.NET.

member.summary: Display only references to Web services (.asmx) that use ASP.NET.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.WCFReference.Interop.StorageNameValidationState
member.summary: Provides an enumeration used to validate a new reference name and namespace in an object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.WCFReference.Interop.StorageNameValidationState.SNVS_ExistingNamespace
member.summary: The namespace is already being used. If the project system supports two storages that share a single namespace, the method will return true.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.WCFReference.Interop.StorageNameValidationState.SNVS_InvalidNamespace
member.summary: The namespace is invalid for the project language. The reference name is invalid in the file system. The method will return false.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.WCFReference.Interop.StorageNameValidationState.SNVS_InvalidReferenceName
member.summary: The reference name is invalid in the file system. The method will return false.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.WCFReference.Interop.StorageNameValidationState.SNVS_NewNamespace
member.summary: The namespace is valid. The method will return true.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.WCFReference.Interop.StorageNameValidationState.SNVS_ReferenceNameConflicts
member.summary: A file (.svcmap) already exists in the directory. The method will return false.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.WCFReference.Interop.StorageNameValidationState.SNVS_UnsupportedNamespace
member.summary: The namespace is valid for the project language, but it is not supported in the current project system. The method will return false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.WCFReference.Interop.SVsAddWebReferenceDlg3
member.summary: A service that exposes the unmanaged interface.
